course.title: Monstrous Literature
course.description: This course will explore the literature of the monstrous, with a particular focus on two extraordinary periods: the Renaissance and the Romantic era. From moral monstrosities like the overreaching Faust to physical monstrosities like Frankenstein's creature, monsters defy the order of things. Their very bodies may transgress the norm, or their ambitions seek to overthrow our entire world. What does the monster mean? And what do these figures reveal about our attitudes toward the future, toward cultural outsiders, toward the body and the boundaries between human and non-human? Authors include Montaigne, Marlowe, Shakespeare, Spenser, Milton, Goethe, Byron, and Shelley.
